description:
Look. I'm a born San Franciscan. I love my City; won't hear any slander about it. 

But. 

If I'm being honest, 5 years in Philadelphia did spoil me when it comes to deli sandwiches. Felt like nearly every block had a very respectable sandwich deli who could turn out an 8/10 italian hoagie in 5 minutes flat. 

We're sadly lacking when it comes to a proper concentration of that civic virtue -- and no, Togo's DOESN'T count. 

Enter Two Sons' Sandwiches. 

Now, I'm no sandwich cheapskate, so I'm not gonna argue with y'all about price. These folks have it down where it counts: 

* REAL SAN FRANCISCO SOURDOUGH -- crunchy, but soft enough to contain a sandwich
* THIN SLICED DELI MEAT -- idk what the rest of y'all are doing with these 1/8th inch thick slices of turkey, but THAT'S NOT HOW YOU MAKE A SANDWICH. Two Sons' has this DOWN
* PROPER SANDWICH SIZE -- hipster places need to GTFOH with these cutesy sandwiches with truly un-cute prices; if it's a two-digit sandwich, I should have to eat it with two hands
* SPEED -- in, order and out in under 15 minutes, how it's supposed to be

I'ma be here a lot, but at least now i won't be here for any further San Francisco Sandwich Slander.
author: Working M.

description:
Ridiculous. This place has subpar sandwiches.

I ordered their special - the smokin' joe and it was a pretty lackluster experience. There was way too much aioli (more of a watery mayo) and they didn't double check to see what I wanted in the sandwich. Put way too many pickles and stacked too much in the center. The sandwich was supposed to be toasted but the cheese didnt even have the chance to melt. In a city full of such good food, you could probably make a much better sandwich at the same price, ~$12.

Small nits about the sanitation: there was a tray filled with water with a few knives used to cut avocado, and the water was nasty: some white flakes floating around inside. Blegh.
author: Albert C.

description: Pretty great sandwich shop. Large menu on the wall behind the counter features build your own sandwiches, toasted sandwiches, cold sandwiches, paninis, and breakfast sandwiches. In the morning you can also get bagels and coffee. They have a wall of chips and a cooler of bottled drinks. The service was outstanding and food came out quick. This no frills sandwich shop is the place to go. Parking is free on the street and plentiful.
author: Alan H.

description:
With the way Yelp has helped connect people to previously unknown gems, it's pretty rare to find amazing places that still manage to fly under the radar.  And yet, there are places out there like Two Sons'.  Seriously, how the HELL does this place only have 166 reviews?!  Not that I really mind them not being "a thing" - I love being able to walk right in and order!  Talk about the perfect neighborhood gem...

While there are several spots in the area that can offer up some tasty sandwiches, none of them can compete with Two Sons'.  Not only are their sandwiches amazingly delicious, but there are so many to choose from - over 30 varieties, as well as the option to create your own (starting at $8.49, with over 30 meats and cheeses to pick from!).  Add in their breakfast items and daily specials and it would take forever and a day to try everything they have to offer!

-- THE SMOKIN' JOE - Smoked Turkey, Smoked Ham, Smoked Gouda, and Bacon topped with Chipotle Aioli and Jalapeno Potato Chips (toasted)...$11.29
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/two-sons-sandwiches-san-francisco?select=hT-2hP0Cm786sDjq0g7CYA)
Between the smoked meats and cheeses, this had a nice smokiness to it. The aioli and chips gave it a slight kick as well, which was offset by the veggies.  Though it bordered on being a little too smokey, this was still both solid and unique.

-- WHATCHA TALKIN' ABOUT WILBUR - Ham, Bacon, and Prosciutto topped with Smoked Gouda on a Roll, toasted...10.99 
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/two-sons-sandwiches-san-francisco?select=MEyhwUG7yOg_kUR9aqFqTw)
It's close, but of all of the sandwiches I've tried, this one is my favorite!  Talk about a pork lover's dream - love how well the ham, bacon, and prosciutto complemented each other.  Their Dutch Crunch is amazing, too!

-- CALLING COBB - Roasted Turkey, Ham, Bacon, and Avocado, topped with Bleu Cheese on a Roll (toasted)...$10.49
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/two-sons-sandwiches-san-francisco?select=K1IcVCSYZxCMUcuI_TzCkw)
Quite simply, this tasted like a Cobb Salad...but better!  The bleu cheese isn't overwhelmingly strong (in case you were worried), but there's still just enough.  I especially liked the avocado and bacon though, because, you know...avocado and bacon.

-- DIRTY BIRD - Peppered Turkey, Salami, and Swiss Cheese with Spicy Mayo...$9.49
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/two-sons-sandwiches-san-francisco?select=fAipvBpB3oXXZTUl4ZrnSQ)
Other than its peppery flavor, the turkey got kind of buried in this.  Not a big deal though, as their salami was terrific.  Still, the spicy mayo was the real star - so flavorful!  If this is what a "dirty bird" tastes like, I don't ever want it to be clean!

-- MY GOUDA'S GREEN - Roasted Turkey & Hot Coppa topped with Smoked Gouda on a Roll (toasted)...$9.29
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/two-sons-sandwiches-san-francisco?select=h4uW3ayIzMdOA48gTaFYwg)
I'd never though of turkey and coppa going together, but this showed me otherwise!  Admittedly, while the turkey and gouda were fine, the coppa is what made this shine.  It may not have had a ton of heat, but it still had just enough to perk up my taste buds.

-- CLUCK FOR A BUCK - Grilled Chicken, Bacon, and American Cheese on a Roll (toasted)...$9.49
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/two-sons-sandwiches-san-francisco?select=RiUuqMSsitKVa9sDzdSP9g)
For whatever reason, I usually shy away from getting chicken in my sandwiches (there are so many more interesting meats), but this was great!  Especially the chicken, which was surprisingly moist.  Despite how the mix of ingredients is kind of basic, this isn't too shabby!

Given how extensive their selection of sandwiches is, it's still crazy to me how the six I've tried still make up less than a fifth of their menu.  Which means I have at least 24 reasons to come back!  Toss in their friendly and quick service, along with their budget friendly portions and prices (their sandwiches are huge), and Two Sons' has quickly become my favorite sandwich shop in SF!  I just hope they don't ever become TOO popular...
author: Mike L.

description: The sandwiches here are okay. I couldn't really tell if the ingredients were fresh or not, and the bread was got a bit soggy after a few minutes. The wait during lunch time is really long too: up to a 30 minutes wait. Unfortunately there are a lot of other great sandwich places in the area like Tartine (although you might need to walk farther for those).
author: Brian C.

description: Great and giant sandwiches - the bread is very delicious. If you have experience going to the best SF sandwich shops, I think you'll agree you get more bang for your buck here over Ike's.
author: Danny R.

description:
California livin', toasted, on dutch crunch, sub cheddar for pepper jack.

This place is bomb - I've never had a bad sandwich here. The menu is expansive and adventurous. The staff, super friendly. Be sure to call ahead if it's prime time - they always run out of dutch crunch UGHH.
author: Adriana G.

description:
How have I not been here before . One of the best sandwiches spot in the Bay Area let alone SF .

Get the Quirky Turkey. Unbelievable
author: Matthew R.

description:
Got two tasty smoked roast beef toasted Sando's 
First time here drove by a bunch and finally stopped. Glad I did.
author: B G.

description:
This place is simply the bomb. I work right across the street and come here all the time. Some of the best subs iv ever had including NY delis and friendly family ran service where they remember you and appretiate your business. 

For 9 or 10 bucks you get a huge sub stacked with boars head meats and cheeses and the the menu is endless. You could eat here every day and take months to try them all. They also have a good selection of chips and sides.

Today I had the Watchu Talking Bout Wilber. Ham, bacon, prosciutto, and smoked gouda loaded with vegies. All the breads are good but I went with the dutch crunch which is off the chain.
author: Sean G.

description: Very good sandwiches and great customer service always is a pleasure come here also if there is long line good job guys
author: Michele B.

description:
Really good!!!
I was hesitant to try it out, I've always loved Roxies by Balboa pool,
But OmG just a perfect combination.
Loved the freshness of the ingredients, really had that crunch .

Loved the California livin
author: Nancy A.

description:
This is one of my favorite sandwich places.  I love everything here and it always tastes great.  Come check it out!

Ordered the Dirty Bird and added chicken salad and cucumbers on Dutch Crunch.  It was really good.
author: Raja D.

description: Staff was helpful in figuring out the best sandwich for me and it was so dang good. Bread and produce was fresh.
author: Mason M.

description: One of the best sandwiches I've had. I love the "pep in your step" with a French roll. I could have this everyday
author: Mounika R.

description: Have to say one of the best sandwiches in the area.... pass the pastrami with sauerkraut added...
author: Keeks P.

description: Awesome service and sandwiches. Got to the counter, ordered my sandwich, and was handed my sandwich before I was even done paying... and it was exceptionally good.
author: Travis N.

description: BLT with spicy mayo. Get it. You won't be sorry.
author: Archana P.

description: Omg!!!! Best sandwhich I've had ever!!!!! So many options but whatever you have a taste for they got!!! My son wanted a sandwhich and we ended up here!!! Best place ever!!!!
author: Alexander M.

description:
A great selection of sandwiches with interesting combinations or you can build your own.  My only gripe is that they were out of dutch crunch and it was only 2pm!  Btw, the bread is fantastic and you can't go wrong with the roll and sourdough as well.

We had the pastrami on sourdough and the club on the french roll.  They were both delicious and huge.  Service is quick and the servers were super friendly.  

I love that they keep track of the loyalty card where the 9th purchase if free.  Just use the computer screen and enter your phone number so everytime you buy one it will tell you how your count.  It's about time that all loyalty card place get rid of print and do this instead!
author: Seung Eun C.

description:
Went here in December with coworkers, ordered a yummy salad.  My cowkrers order and their sandwiches came in a jiffy. 
My salad was a little longer but I asked for my chicken separately so no worries. I got my meal and found an error in my salad, shared it with them and they immediately made it right. The employee was very gracious about it! The owner was very gracious and apologetic. I appreciated the small business owner vibe of taking care of the customer by both the employee and owner. My coworkers loved their sandwiches, and I my salad. 

Will return if I'm back in San Francisco and in that area.
author: S S.

description:
Have driven by this joint many times, and took the plunge to get a sammie on the way home. 
Loved the friendliness and banter with the cashier, a co-owner. Anyhoo, had a pastrami & Swiss cheese on a dutch crunch roll w/ extra everything. Wow, it was GREAT!

The guys assembling the sammie were nice/friendly/accommodating.

Will be back! Highly recommend. Its across from UPS central casting, but didn't see anyone in brown outfits.
author: Matsuo U.

description: Such a solid sandwich shop. Every ingredient is fantastic - bread, meats, veggies, all solid. I just wish they were open on weekends
author: Joseph K.

description: Anything you could want at a deli and great rolls as well. I like the sweet roll. Parking is fairly easy and calling ahead is a good idea. They also have daily special and a bunch of specialty sandwiches that look good.
author: Chuck R.

description: These sandwiches are fantastic. Huge and reasonably priced and sumptuous. We've ordered from the regular menu and we've made our own, all to our satisfaction. Cluck for a Buck and Mongolian Monster are excellent. Great Dutch crunch bread, great proprietary sauces. Made fast and fresh. I would recommend ordering ahead to avoid the lunch rush, which gets pretty packed by 12pm
author: Matthew R.

description:
This is a solid sandwich shop. I think some of the underwhelmed reviewers may have the wrong expectations. This is not Deli Board or AK Subs. This place is more like a local deli sandwich spot (instead of the other ones that pretend to be that, but are something different). 

My favorite is My Gouda's Green. Most sandwiches are just cold cut based, but they jazz them up. Service is great and there's a solid drink selection, no joke. You must factor that into your ratings. Stick with the cold cut based sandwiches and you can't go wrong. They are filling, feel free to split one and this becomes a cheap lunch (gasp).
author: Gonzalo S.

description: Very solid sandwiches. We're not talking gourmet here, just good, flavorful, filling sandwiches. Unbelievable selection of meat, topping and sauces. Oh, and they're really friendly, too.
author: Aaron A.

description:
All the sandwiches I've tried here were impressive. You won't be disappointed!!

So far I've tried the Triple C, Mongolian Monster, and the Buffalo Firebird. ALL AMAZING!!! & super flavorful!

Their sandwiches are HUGE and they seriously have the best dutch crunch bread! Very fresh and by far the best dutch crunch I've had at any sandwich joint.
author: Leilani Y.

description: This place is the best.  I love the BLT on sliced wheat with spicy mayo.  I haven't tried any other sandwich because i am obsessed with this one.  Get it about once a week.  Plus the staff is the best.  They guy behind the counter is so friendly.  Also, great selection of chips!
author: Natalie K.

description: For me this place is very good. I honestly think the prices are reasonable. The bread is fresh the meat is top grade. This is my 3x eating at this spot. The sandwich in a Dutch crunch toasted is off the hook. Very addicting. Workers are polite. I just hope these non san Franciscan snob yuppie man bun panochas don't find out about this diamond. Thanks for the delicious food.
author: Craig L.

description: This is one if the best sandwich/deli spots I have ever been to! Thier bread is fresh with a flaky crust softer in the center of the bread. the produce they use is fresh. The have a good choice of sandwiches, panini and salads. They also do breakfast, Ikes sandwiches has nothing on them!!! The staff is fun and friendly , I will be returning for more of their delicious sandwiches
author: Rebecca K.

description:
Shockingly good!!  I definitely found my new favorite sandwich place!  

I had the mongolian monster and I have to say, it was truly an incredible sandwich.
author: J E.

description: I'm from the bay area and I never been to this place.  I stopped by after craving a sandwich and I can tell you it was amazing
author: Danielle W.

description: I've probably had hundreds of sandwiches in San Francisco, and this wins hands down. Took a bit of a detour today from the usual lunch spots near work, and now I'm gonna have to make it a regular thing. Had "Greek of the Week" on dutch crunch and it was pretty much perfect.
author: Dylan P.

description: Absolutely incredible sandwiches! The "Triple C" is my favorite. One of the few places in the city where you can get Dutch Crunch bread! Just wish it was longer and open on the weekends!
author: Emma B.

description:
Seriously one of the best sandwiches I've ever had, let alone in SF or that neighborhood. If you are nearby, do yourself a favor and pick up something to go.

The sandwiches are not cheap ($8-13 each) but they are big enough to comfortably eat over two meals. I had the 'Pass that Pastrami' sandwich and would have it again (actually, I'm going to for dinner tonight because I have leftovers)! They serve Boudin bread as well as 

Service was impressive as the team is helpful, friendly, and patient. This came in handy has my lunchmate took a surprising 4-5 minutes to choose between the 20+ sandwich options.
author: Colt S.

description: I have to continue the same facts already stated, the staff is very nice. I used the online feature through yelp to pay ahead and my order was ready at the time it said that it would be. Lastly the sandwich was worth every penny!
author: Jimmy P.

description: Always great customer service! Top notch subs and well with the $! Definitely call and order ahead of time because there's always a line out the door - which is a good sign
author: Cole N.

description: One of the best sandwiches I've ever had. Make sure you get Dutch crunch and have it toasted!
author: Kari N.

description:
Friendly staff, amazing food! Just make sure to have an appetite when you go.

I've been going to this place about once every two weeks for the past year and for the price, the sandwiches are packed with high-end really tasty meat and there are so many good options! I also love the macaroni salad. The staff is very nice and Ordering Ahead especially around lunch time is super quick and easy. 

I only had one experience where the macaroni salad wasn't up to par and they immediately refunded my money and the next time I arrived they had remembered me (3+ weeks later) and gave me a free salad on the side! Such great service!
author: Sylvia B.

description: I've lived in the area for 5 years and always driven by this place,  but paid no attention.   Figured it was another sandwich place where I could make it at home.   Nope.  Now I come here at least once a week.   And they aren't participating in the sf $15+ price badwagon.
author: A A.

description:
An excellent sandwich for a reasonable price.
When you work in Potrero hill, there are few good options for food (the local Whole Foods gets boring pretty quickly). This is a great and inexpensive option for gourmet sandwich lovers. Pretty much all the sandwiches are awesome but I especially recommend the 'Pass that Pastrami' and 'I'm your fajita'. The Dutch crunch is one of the best I've had - definitely better than the one in Ike's.
On the flip side, the wait can be excruciatingly long around lunch time (~25 mins or more).
author: Sudeep K.

description:
I've given Two Sons two chances, but neither time they really impressed me.

The first time I got their falafel sandwich, which came with (count 'em) three tiny falafel. They also put a ton of sauce on it, which made the pita all soggy. I then got their pesto panini, which was overly salty. It was a good amount of food, but I had to get some water to finish it.
author: Casey S.

description:
Awesome sandwich place!!! This is exactly what I need and want in a sandwich. After switching jobs and working in Potrero Hill, there is no lunch places here. Although they forgot my cheese in the sandwich, don't really blame them since they had such a long line to deal with during lunch. 

Tried the "3X Crazy" today, and it was awesome! A great portion of meat and everything was so fresh and yummy. Definitely give it a try when you're in the area and craving an amazing sandwich.
author: Polly L.

description: Brilliant sandwich shop. Great service and even better food. Had the Mongolian Monster on a Dutch Crunch bread. I love the sense of humor in naming the sandwiches. Will be going back soon.
author: Anirban S.

description: I had passed by here a few times and wanted to give it a try as I loved the name and cartoon images on the front.  I knew I could expect a sturdy sandwich here.  I asked one of the "sons" which one I should get, and I told him I wanted something cold and spicy, he recommended "Dirty Bird".  I tried it 2 hours later and was very pleased with it.  Really fresh taste, the meat was top notch, I was completely satisfied.  Great job!
author: Victor S.

description: I always drive by this place and tell myself that I need to come try this place.  Finally today was the the day.  The gentleman behind the counter recommended the special of the day which was a toasted tri tip sandwich.  Two thumbs up!  Big sandwich but didn't make me feel too heavy afterwards.  Service is great.  Nice clean eating area and clean working area behind the counter. I'll definitely be coming back.
author: David S.

description:
Highly recommend this place its small family oriented delicious sandwhiches all around 
Nice staff always welcomes you , dont rush you to order allow you to take your time .
author: Alex G.

description:
I found this place from the Yelp sandwich list.  I had high expectations from all the 5 star reviews.  Admittedly I have been spoiled by great sandwiches in the bay area.  Sadly this place did not live up.

I had the Mongolian Monster on Dutch crunch bread.  This sandwich has roast beef, munster cheese, jalapeño, Sriracha, teriyaki and lettuce.  I could not taste either the teriyaki or Sriracha and the sandwich seemed a bit bland.  I would have liked more roast beef.

I also tried the BBQ beef sandwich with roast beef, A-1 sauce, and Swiss cheese. Again this was rather bland. 

The sandwiches are huge and should satisfy the largest appetites.  Great service.  I don't see myself coming back for a mediocre sandwich and I'm not in this neighborhood often.
author: Michael M.

description: Great food.  Missing a star because they close on the weekends.  Which is good for them but not so much for me.
author: Kashif M.

description:
Slow sandwich makers do they know lunch for construction workers are 30 minutes? They burnt my bread and forgot to put meat in the two sandwiches I got!
I hate yelp and this is one of the few places I have helped!
30 dollars with the tip for two sandwiches plus waters is a joke! Ike's place with ten people in front rolls faster! Won't be going again!
author: Konstantine A.

description:
If standing in a long line with nowhere to sit afterward while you munch on above average, but overpriced, meat centric sandwich is your thing then... yippee you have found your go to. I haven't however.

Just ok, but nothing special.
author: Easwud C.

description: Late review. The sandwiches here are so good. The triple C with Avocado and Jalapeños is out of this world. Huge sandwich and they have great prices.  Will go again for sure.
author: Kam H.

description: We ordered about 12 sandwiches at lunch time and they had them ready in about 10 minutes and they were all fantastic. Customer service was spot on and the place was very clean. I will definitely be back.
author: S. C.

description: Love. Love. Love this place! I always get Don't Be A Chicken on Dutch crunch and it's the best! One time they ran out of chicken salad, so I tried their special, The Smokin' Joe, and it was equally amazing. All the sandwiches here are as big as your face and super affordable (for SF). I can only finish half in one sitting so I typically split it with a co-worker. Plus the employees are super friendly. I'll keep coming back again and again.
author: Katherine Y.

description: They make a dam good sandwich. Best I've had in a long time. Very good deal for the size of the sandwich. Super fresh ingredients. I got the 3x crazy. Highly recommend it.
author: Joseph E.

description: The sandwiches we ordered were tasty...but the two Latin men that worked behind the counter were slow, did not follow the basic requests we had, and then proceed to speak in Spanish to each other  como casi todas las personas no hablan espanol. Rude help.
author: David C.

description: Grab and go style: great sandwich (I got the california one with turkey and avocados).
author: Shifali G.

description:
We have two sandwich was excellent!!
Meat taste so good
Bread, was so fresh and crunchy
author: Dan D.

description:
Great small business and alternative to whole foods for a lunch. Expect 7-10 for a hulking sandwich. 
Dutch crunch is the way to go here. 

I had the corned beef sandwich with cabbage for the St Patrick's day special. Why can't they have it all the time?!
author: Calvin C.

description: Sandwiches are delicious and well made with lots of meat.  I had the Brisket special, which was huge!  Friendly, very casual atmosphere.  The brisket was good and plentiful, but not strongly seasoned.  Taste of pickles was a bit strong.  I would definitely go again.
author: A L.

description:
They showed me some unusual coins in their register that they got from customers, but wouldn't trade me them when I offered to pay for them. 

Sandwich was ok. The owner kept pointing at me and whispering. It was hard for me to enjoy my sandwich because they were being really weird and akward.
author: Linz S.

description:
We were in the area around lunch time following a tour at Anchor Brewing Company. Since the Bay Area seems to the only place where one can consume dutch crunch we immediately tried to find a place that could make us a sandwich.

We took the short walk over to the store. Their sandwiches are pretty dang good. The staff is friendly and welcoming. There's a couple of seats inside to eat, if needed.

It's a little pricey, but a good sandwich always is. Especially when it's packed with fresh meats and veggies.
author: Mike F.

description: my first time having a sandwich from here & i'm hooked. friendly staff & nice & clean! during lunch time it's a little bit of a wait. well worth it though. #dirtybird #sogood
author: Marie A.

description:
Excellent sandwiches. Seriously. 

I wish I lived closer so I could grab lunch there everyday. The service was fast, real, and courteous. The menu is huge with a zillion creative choices. 

I always get the sandwich with cream cheese if there is one, and this didn't disappoint. I can't remember the name but it was clever. 

Get the Dutch crunch bread. 

Yum.
author: Aggie N.

description: Unique deli sandwiches. I tried the Cluck for a Buck and the BBQ Burglar both with dutch crunch. Fresh ingredients. Friendly folks. Accessible parking.
author: E.J. P.

description:
A solid customizable sandwich that excites the taste buds. 

You have plenty of high quality breads, meats and toppings to choose from. The customer service is excellent and the wait time is short. There are plenty of chips and drinks to choose from as well. If you're interested in a good sandwich and your close to Portero Hill then it's a no brainer to come try their sandwiches.
author: Marco M.

description: I eat here regularly because the sandwiches are massive, prices are low, and they have delicious bread.  The menu variety is great too.  There are maybe 40 signature sandwiches that you can select, or you can create your own.  Super friendly staff, too.  Know me by name now.  A real, quality family joint.
author: Peter L.

description:
I really want to love this place because they are right across the street from me. But their service is lacking. Maybe it's because I've been here so long I remember the previous owner, Fawaz, and how awesome he and his wife were when they owned the shop. Nowadays, every time I come into this place, there is always something off about my experience. The curt hello. The sandwiches being made in an incorrect order. It's like, "Man! Is this hard work?? Do I not look techie/hipster enough to deserve great service?"

I'd probably forgive such terse circumstances if the sandwiches were fantastic. But they're really not. I would rather drive to SSF and grab Darby Dan's or Little Lucca than to walk across the street for their overpriced, just ok, sandwiches.
author: R D.

description: incredible sandwich! Very accommodating with orders and the taste is unbelievable. the bread is amazing and the quality of meat is great!!
author: michael m.

description: This place is fine. They make sandwiches, which are fine. Nothing special though. And a little pricey for just average fare.
author: Jeff T.

description: Top 3 sandwich place in the city. The Don Dada is a personal favorite, but everything here is legit. Atmosphere is lacking, but who really cares.
author: Scott C.

description:
this used to be my go to Sandwich spot. I eat lunch later than the masses, and the last three times I have stopped in they have been completely out of rolls. I went in today just before two (They are open till 4), and the guy said yup were out of rolls, but he could make a wrap. WTF, does McDonalds run out of buns?

I understand running out every once in a while, but for the last three times to have no rolls two hours before closing is a joke. 

Gus's Deli just down the street is now my spot for Sandos in this hood.
author: J. C.

description: I eat here at least once a week. The sandwiches are fantastic. I highly recommend pastrami on a Dutch crunch roll.
author: Simon A.

description:
My coworkers and I regularly went to Two Sons for our lunch because they are nearby, and we used to like it. Our recent orders have been disappointing and I don't think it is worth going back to anymore.

I had the Cobb the Builder salad, and the salad just has all *iceberg* lettuce in large pieces, and not even enough dressing for the whole salad, two tiniest bacon/avocado don't make it any better. I used to love it, but it has gone downhill. 

My coworker ordered a veggie salad with avocado, and only to find out there was NO avocado when the order arrived in our office. 

Several other folks had some issues with their order too. There must have been a change in their sandwich maker or management or something is not right! 

All in all, I have had other better sandwich places to go now. Won't go back and order.
author: Lena H.

description: Decided to eat here after just arriving in SF.  Worked up quite an appetite traveling across the country and this looked like it might hit the spot. It didn't disappoint.  I went with the Mongolian Monster. They offer a generous quantity of meat on bread that is just crispy enough on the outside with a nice soft interior (the french baguette).  The combination of teriyaki sauce and sriracha worked. They also offer a solid selection of niche soft drinks.  Reasonably priced. Friendly staff.  A great first meal in SF
author: Joe J.

description:
This place used to be another sandwich shop called Calabria Bros, which was not up my alley because I don't usually like cured meats, and I especially don't like them COLD.  Two Sons offers deliciously toasted and ironed paninis with lots of turkey options, served with a variety of sauces, fresh vegetables, and cheese they melt down and ooze over your breadroll.  Verdict?  Way better than Whole Foods subs, not quite as gourmet as Market & Rye but also simpler and lighter on your wallet.


---- SANDWICHES ----

Honey I'm Stoned:  4 stars

California Livin': 4 stars
Turkey, Avocado, pickles, mustard and mayo. Had it on Dutch crunch and it was good even though untoasted.

I Am Your Fajita:  4.5 stars
Love the juicy, crunchy yummy peppers in this chicken sandwich.

Pesto Man Panini: 4 stars

Quirky Turkey: 4.5 stars
Turkey, cranberry sauce, arugula, pickled cucumber and radish, mustard.

Gobble Wobble: 3.5 stars
Turkey, cream cheese, cranberry sauce. A bit too much like a kid's meal but I should have expected that from the comfort-food ingredients.

My Gouda's Green: 3 stars
Roasted turkey, hot coppa, smoked Gouda. Delicious ingredients but it really needs some sauce or aioli because it was dry and the toasted bread abraded the roof of my mouth badly.


---- PANINIS ----

An Offer You Can't Refuse: 2.5 stars
Eggplant is perfect but the chicken is cold and dry. Ciabatta bread is pretty bland.

Always Sunny in Salsalito:  3.5 stars
This is a square panini, smaller and flatter than the regular sandwiches but dense.  Packed with flavour but slightly dry.


I love sitting at the bar and reading while nomming on my sandwich. If only they served soup and a glass of water here, this would be my go-to lunch spot several times a week!
author: Letitia L.

description:
This sandwich shop is through and through amazing. It's run by two brothers. Their sandwiches and service makes the visit a unique experience.

The sandwiches are huge and extremely good. While the filling is juicy the bread stays dry. They have several choices of bread. The sourdough is delicious (and I'm usually not a big fan.

This place is definitely worth checking out. I recommend the California living sandwich!
author: Christian M.

description: Best sandwiches in San Francisco.  Get the Mongolian Monster, its definitely different, and so delicious.  The owners are super nice too.
author: Ryan O.

description: Giant and delicious sandwiches. Not bad considering most $10 sandwiches in SF are half the size of Two Sons. They also have a loyalty program which is nice.
author: Jamie S.

description:
Two Sons Sandwiches makes gourmet sammies using boars' head meats. 8ish. pricey?  just dropping in for a brew.

flatscreen: mexican tv

pour: "2 sons blend", roger's coffee(sm 2.75) drip pour
-bold, smooth,.....easy sipping

drip:
-service laid back.
-spend time watching my wheels in the red zone..
author: Victor G.

description: Great Sandwiches and fair prices.  They were quick with my order and I was in/out in about 2 minutes  (granted slow day). The sandwich was huge and delicious.  They didn't over do it with the toppings, and let the taste of the sandwich do the talking.  Definitely coming back!
author: Garrett L.

description:
This place does NOT disappoint!! Their sandwiches are tasty huge and have a nice mix of ingredients! The sandwiches run between nine and $10 but definitely worth it considering how big they are. The sandwich that I've got the last two times I've been there has been a sandwich and include Tam to Sean mustard arugula pickled red onions on Dutch crunch and it's absolutely delicious!! 

It is certainly my go to spot for sandwiches
author: Brittany E.

description: People there were friendly, and the Wild chicken was great. Hot and soft and juicy on the inside, crunchy on the outside, delightful overall. I know why this place is hyped up. I don't live in the area anymore, but I'll visit if I ever go back.
author: David C.

description: This is like a New York deli,  without the attitude.  Sandwiches are big and juicy, service quick,  and the vibe friendly. I like the Mongolian Monster; well worth $10.
author: Karl H.

description:
It's weird. I used to hate this place back when it was Calabria Bros. And then they shut down and were replaced by Two Sons. Their styles of preparing the sandwiches aren't that different, but now instead of tasting like cardboard, the sandwiches here are actually delicious.

There are at least 30 cleverly-named sandwiches, and the ones I have tried so far have all been excellent.

- It's Always Sunny in Salsalito: This blend of pesto, onion, and Monterrey jack will definitely brighten up your day. It was slightly dry, but otherwise delicious: 4/5

- Super Smoked Steakhouse: The taste is A1, literally. It's slightly messy for finger-food, but  it makes you feel like you're in a 1990's Carl's Jr. commercial (as opposed to being in an actual CJ restaurant): 5/5

- I am your "Fahita": Another amazing sandwich. You can definitely feel the Force of the grilled peppers melting in your mouth. 4/5

- Mongolian Monster: Very tasty roast beef with grilled onions. It's a bit spicy with the Jalapenos, so those without big feet might want to leave them out. 5/5

=====

Two Sons uses the same amount of meat regardless of the size of the bread. The Dutch Crunch is excellent, so I usually stick go with that. Focaccia bread is good, but a bit small. The meat may overflow to the side.
author: Nathan Y.

description: Great sandwich place, very clean and prompt with sandwiches. Always smiling faces, and friendly staff members. Sandwiches are excellent,  and only takes about 5 minutes to prepare. Best sandwich Is the Greuben,  with pastrami and thousand island dressing. We will miss Joe, but George is just as great and courteous with making sandwiches. Great shop, definitely one of the best sandwich shops in SF,  prices are great and service is always with a smile.
author: Michael B.

description:
These guys are artists when it comes to their sandwiches. If you're a Foodie you'll love this place for the creativity of their sandwiches. If you like to grub you'll appreciate the size of their sandwiches. I'm trying to make my way through the entire menu but every sandwich I try is my new favorite! The flavors are just as creative as their names.

Great flavors, great size, great value!
author: D. C.

description:
Easy parking, friendly staff, clean place, variety of chips and drink options, and of course great sandwiches! 

6 STARS!!!!
author: Nicole F.

description: I am a sandwich lover, i literally often wake up craving a tasty combo of meat, fillings  on a roll... These guys hit the spot. Kudos to the cute guy behind the counter who was mad patient as my eyes glazed over staring at the menu... I went super boring turkey on sour roll, no cheese added peppers and avocado.  Sandwich f***king large is what handed me, and I am a happy girl. I will return maybe study the menu prior to going in.
author: Traci R.

description: I know I'd been to Two Sons Sandwiches years ago but never wrote a review.  I went again last weekend and wondered why it had been so long since I'd been back.  The two sons are super friendly and great to chat with.  Their sandwich board is huge and  a little overwhelming but just take some time, ask for suggestions and you won't be steered wrong.  My wife got My Gouda's Green and I got the Whatchu Talkin About WIlbur.  Both great selections with just the right amount of meat and cheese to not be too overpowering.
author: Blake B.

description: These guys are rad. Great, big delicious sandwiches all rolled up in butcher paper. Exactly what I need midday doing physical work to give me energy to bang out the second half of my work day.
author: Alex S.

description:
My first sandwich was soggy/mushy and not up to par. Two Son's was kind enough to offer a replacement sandwich. 

Minus the 2 types of Mayo, 1 type of mustard and tons of pesto, I had a good Pastrami sandwich.

Good job on customer service/customer satisfaction.

(BTW My colleague got a replacement sandwich as well and liked it the second time around)
author: Ed A.

description: Amazing sandwiches. Good people. Family run. This is the kind of place you want to give your money to because the quality is across the board awesome and the people are super friendly. I come here at least once a week for a sandwich and they are consistently the best. Go out of your way to come here.
author: Jak K.

description:
Had to go back and give Ike's 4 stars so I could give this one 5. 

Not that I've never had a sandwich before - but I was trippin about the sandwich I ate there for a while. AMAZING. 

Has a very classic deli theme to it. The names on all of their items add to the experience. Worth every penny.

I'm an SF native that now lives in Seattle - this wasn't open when I lived there, but it's now going to be a stop every time I'm back in the Bay.
author: Nick O.

description:
The cluck for a buck Sammie is heavenly, a great combo of chicken, bacon, american and sandwich fixins (its even better on sourdough bread) Also tried the chicken salad and chicken pesto panini, which were decent.

I'd like to come here more for lunch but there's always a line out the door.
author: Marie W.

description: Many unique sandwiches, great selection of boars head. One of my favorite delis in SF. The owners are super friendly. Definitely Recommend
author: dee s.

description:
I've been ordering here for several months, and every time I do, I hope they get my order right!! You would think, a $10 sandwich would get done right! 
Unfortunately, I only love hot pastrami sandwiches, never have they got my order right. Whether I call it in or fax it over!! 
Sincerely,
Disappointed
author: Ness M.

description:
First and foremost, if there was a quarter star to give that's what I would rate this place.  

Being a local business owner in Portrero Hill, I was craving a deli sandwich.  Being an avid yelper I found this deli sandwich spot which was a few short blocks away.  Since it is the city and all I didn't expect it to be cheap, but I didn't expect the quality to be so poor.  

For $10.00 this is what I received: 

-A sourdough roll that was harder than a brick (even the birds I threw it on the ground for didn't give it a second look) 
-ONE slice of turkey with maybe 5 slices of salami (keep in mind $10 sandwich!) 
-the regular tomato, onion, mustard, with salt and pepper 

ALL that for 10 dollars.. Fml.  Talk about highway robbery! 

For future Yelpers looking for a deli sandwich spot in the Portrero area, Safeway would be a better bet!
author: Lindsey W.

description: Dutch Crunch is always fresh. They are fast even if the line is long, which it usually is. Definitely worth it if you're looking for a tasty sando in P-Hill.
author: Jesse B.

description: amazing sando. it was delicious. i killed the massive thing and wanted more. minus one star because bread to filling ratio is...more carby than desired.
author: Christina L.

description: Definitely good. Definitely not mind-blowing. The dutch crunch was fresh, crunchy and tasty right out of the oven, and the meat was great (boar's head meats). But, the teriyaki sauce on my Mongolian monster was lacking in flavor, causing the majority of the taste to be overtaken by the sriracha. You get a lot of sandwich, though, which was nice. Overall, you can probably do better, but considering it's in an area where you don't have a lot of food options, this is not bad. Plus half a star for the menu item name puns.
author: Ruobin W.

description:
Two sons reminds me of an old school New York deli with some modern flavor combinations. Personally I like my breads toasted on sandwiches and you can get everything toasted. 

I'm m working my way through the list but the steakhouse is definitely one of my top 3 and even though not on the board they make an EXCELLENT tuna melt on french bread. 

I will be going back again (if you buy 9 sandwiches the 10th is free)
author: Jason R.

description: I absolute love the Mongolian Monster, and the dutch crunch is always superb. My only issue is that they're not open Sundays and they close pretty early - but that's not bad.
author: Phil G.

description: People! You have to try the Triple C !!!! It's a special sandwich, not on the regular menu. Imagine chipotle chicken, chipotle Gouda, and crispy onions exploding in your more. Your parotids will pucker, my god this is one of the best sandwiches I've ever had!!!
author: Tyler M.

description:
Best to accept.

Godfather isn't messing around: www.youtube.com/watch?v=SeldwfOwuL8

An Offer You Can't Refuse isn't either: Grilled chicken, eggplant, marinara sauce, pickles, tomato and lettuce. Cheese if you'd like.

Somehow held together by one gigantic wheat roll. This epic and delicious Two Sons' creation could easily have been two meals. But it was too good.

Their custom blend of one cup at a time Rodger's Coffee kept things caffeinated. Out of nonfat milk but smooth enough to not really need it. 

WiFi is available but your laptop is best kept shut to keep the crumbs out. This sandwich owns you, not the other way around.

Staffed by two incredibly nice and clearly talented gentlemen. Could have been the brothers aka Godfathers of excellent sandwiches.
author: Jason B.

description:
I'm not sure what to make of this place.  I have gone now four times to try and get a sandwich.  First time was on a Sunday when they were closed.  This is a little odd in this day and age, but ok - it's their business and the hours are posted, my bad.  Lesson learned - or would have been learned for a person with a better memory.  Because I am daft, I had to return another Sunday after the gym to try it out before the fact that they are closed Sunday finally sank in.  

Following that misadventure, I tried again when I experienced car engine trouble nearby.  What better way to wait for roadside assistance, I thought, than to finally sample these mythical sandwiches with a 4.5-star Yelp review?  I walk over to their storefront to find the doors wide open and the lights on.  It was a little before four on a Saturday - close to closing time, but not yet past.  I go in, ready to order - 'sorry, we're closed!' says the man, apparently ignorant as to what wide-open doors and bright lights during business hours signify to would-be customers.  I left, not too pleased.

Finally, today, I decided to try one last time.  After again leaving my gym nearby, I double-checked their hours to ensure they were open, and made my way over at 3.  I get there again to find the doors open.  Looks like my curse with this place will be lifted at last!  I walk in, and open my mouth to order - 'sorry, we're out of bread.'  Out of bread.  Out. Of. Bread. A sandwich place.  Ok.

That was strike three for me. I'm glad people have had a good experience with this place, but for me, clearly it wasn't meant to be.  I'll go to sandwich shops with accurate business hours and a supply chain that can keep them from running out of exotic ingredients like 'bread.'
author: Jeff W.

description: Get the Whatchu Talkin' Bout Wilbur on Dutch Crunch. So good.
author: Trevor C.

description:
Ordered a hot pastrami & Swiss on a soft roll..  IT WAS PERFECTLY MADE AND DELICIOUS.  If your live or work in the area, I highly recommend this place.  Even if you have to drive, you won't be sorry. 

I've tried sandwiches at 3 other local establishments.. Non of them comes close.
author: Matt R.

description: Great selection of sandwiches. I recommend the "Buffalo Firebird" or "Cowboy Way". Good value, east coast style deli. Tell em the Bunyan sent ya.
author: Patrick L.

description:
Worst experience ever. This is my first Yelp review that's negative normally I only rate positive because I don't want to hurt the business of any restaurant where maybe the food is not great but where the service is good. I placed an order online and went into the store to add to the order with a sandwich. They were out of every bread except rye and croissant but it was after 2pm and they had a busy day. I left to pickup groceries and when I returned the man at the counter asked if I had someone pickup the Order for me. I had not. They gave my order to someone else!!!! 

If that's not bad enough both men at the counter seemed less than concerned about this. When one said to remake them the other guy huffed in irritation. That was it. I told them to just cancel it and refund the order. 

I live 3 blocks from this place and always wanted to try it. They have quality meats with awesome selections. It was particularly upsetting because my partner had just had surgery and she wanted something simple.

Instead I walked back to Whole Foods Steep and Brew where I placed my custom order and it turned out great.

The folks from Order Ahead where I placed my one sandwich order for pickup at Two Sons immediately called and emailed me and were completely apologetic about what happened and quite frankly embarrassed. They provided excellent customer service. Two Sons - major disappointment.
author: mary helen d.

description: Prompt and friendly service and they make some of the best sandwiches i have had in SF. The "Pep in your step" is a favorite of mine as well as their breakfast sandwiches. I highly recommend Two Sons' to anyone looking for a great deli in the city.
author: Dheeraj S.

description: Great little sandwich place! I ordered the chicken katsu sandwich and it was amazing. Great piece of chicken, great bread, and a a really delicious cole slaw. If you're in the Mission and tired of burritos, this is a great place to check out.
author: Alan T.

description: First time here and it was amazing. I was on my way to McDonald's  bit saw this place on the way so had to stop and check it out.
author: John F.

description: Yeah, definitely a 5 star joint.  Good service, great sandwiches.  My reviews definitely need more words.
author: Don A.

description: I used to work two blocks away from this great little sandwich shop and would go in almost every day for either a morning breakfast bagel or one of their amazing lunch specials. Joe the owner is such a nice guy and goes out of his way to make sure you're happy and is always in such a cheerful mood. I work in the Haight now and try to get over there as often as possible to support these guys and enjoy their amazing sandwiches. Best sandwich shop in SF!!
author: Stephen B.

description: Me and my fiancée stopped here for lunch on our way to a tour at Anchor Brewing. The sandwiches are fantastic! Great variety to pick from and the staff was very friendly.
author: Ryan H.

description:
Great little spot that has a pretty extensive sandwich menu.  I have tried a few now including the Dirty bird and the Hot Pastrami and they are downright delicious!

I'll admit i will miss the old sandwich spot that was there before but am excited to see what other gems are on the menu!
author: Reggie A.

description: Legit place! Fast, friendly service. The sandwiches are definitely big enough to share or save your other half for later and are affordably priced (for SF) at $8-10. Not many veggie options, but they do have beef, poultry, and/or pork options.
author: Deserae W.

description:
On 2 separate occasions there was hair found in the sandwiches when we got back to the office.  

Better get some hair nets or something.  Just telling us that they'll hook you up with another sandwich next time doesn't solve the issue.
author: Craig I.

description: Can we all say "YUM". I've only been here once, but I will definitely go back again. My Samich (Yes, I said "Samich") was really good. The bread was nice and fresh, not that hard stuff that will scratch the roof of your mouth!! :-/. The meat was freshly sliced. One of the best that I've had in a while.
author: C D.

description: This is one darn good sandwich.  Super casual shop. Best sandwich names I've seen in almost forever.  If you are anywhere near Two Son's Sandwiches, stop and eat! You won't regret it.
author: Elizabeth V.

description:
I admit I was sad when the Calabria Bros. moved away, but the Two Sons are more than ample compensation for our loss. Their sandwiches are delicious, huge, imaginative, and have fresh veggies -- which the Calabria Bros. were not into.  They also offer paninis and breakfast sandwiches (yay!). My favorite so far has been their Pep in My Step, which combines flavorful turkey with Sriracha sauce and cheddar in a toasty bundle of deliciousness. I always tell myself I'm going to save half for later...and then I never do. 

I haven't tried it, but my husband is a big fan of their pour-over coffee.
author: Kat H.

description:
This place is great. I work around the corner and frequent it a few times a week. Most often I'm getting a cup of the pour over coffee, and a bagel (when my inner-fat-boy comes out, I get a breakfast croissant). I have never left unsatisfied. The sandwiches are great too, I have yet to work my way through the menu, but I'll do it someday, lol. 

Aside from the food, Joe and the rest of the staff are great guys. If you're in SF, specifically Potrero Hill, make sure you stop by and grab a sandwich.
author: Eamon M.

description: Very tasty, large portion, and fresh ingredients. Highly recommend a sandwich on Dutch crunch bread!
author: Sarah B.

description: it's okay, I had their daily special of tri-tip sandwich. I will try different kind of sandwich next time.
author: KS Y.

description:
Absolutely love this place. Went once on a whim and have been back since. Their ingredients are FRESH, their sandwiches are expertly crafted, and their coffee is really delicious. I can't figure out why their coffee is so damn good, but it is. I also think they are reasonably priced. Probably my favorite sandwich shop in SF.

The only real problem is that they often run out of bread. I can't tell you how many time I've come to the shop during their normal business hours and they say they don't have bread, so they are closing early. I guess that just shows how popular they are.
author: P U.

description:
This place has great sandwich varieties! My favorite is their BLT, super delicious crispy bacon, super yummy sliced bread and oh so saucy spicy mayo. 

The guy who runs the place is a really nice chill guy. He gave our dog some sliced meat for treats. Definitely go here, yummy yummy yum!
author: Tom T.

description: If you're an atheist, the Don Dada sandwich (Salami, Ham, Mortadella, Provolone Cheese and Italian dressing) on sourdough bread just might make you believe in god. It's probably tied with Roli Roti's Porchetta as my favorite sandwich in SF.
author: Andre Y.

description:
My husband and I had dropped our car off down the street to get a new battery and needed to a place to hang out and grab a quick bite to eat for 40 minutes. The owner of Action Auto Care recommended Two Sons Sandwiches and we are so happy he did.

They had so many sandwich options(including panini sandwiches) salads, soups and a HUGE plus for me, veggie options. They also had a nice selection of drink choices(i.e different waters, aloe water, sodas, sparkling lemonade etc) They are definitley super popular because they didn't have a ton of bread options by the time we got there but the staff was very friendly and quick. 

This is a whole in the whole sort of sandwich spot but it had great food and great service at good prices :)
author: Whitney S.

description: Absolutely delicious! I was a little over whelmed by the variety of sandwiches that they offered. Luckily they have a create your own option, so that's what I did and it was spectacular!
author: Tricia L.

description: Had the Greek eggplant sandwich on Dutch bread and it was delicious! The eggplant was well done, not bitter or too soggy and had the right amount of seasoning. The sandwich also comes with feta cheese, which goes really well with the eggplant. Also includes pickles that gave it a little more zest. Everything was very fresh and delicious!
author: Hila S.

description: Nice friendly service at the follow up to Calabria Brothers and a business name that's similar.  Sandwiches are large and they have lots of options and the ingredients taste fresh!  Gotta go more and try more options before I can make a full assessment, but I def wanna come back!
author: Gene X.

description:
I'll admit it, I was heartbroken when Calabria packed their bags and moved on. My co workers and I were excited to see another sandwich spot open not long after. Love the Boudin's bread and Boar's Head meat they use here. It means they stand by quality for the two most important components of a sammy. The glorious combination of quality meat and bread. Respect.

Their prices are very reasonable and they'll make the sammy just the way you want it. Nothing is too crazy or extreme for these guys. I usually get the hot coppa and italian dry salami on sourdough with pepperjack. But lately have been getting their tuna salad. It's not too heavy on mayo and it's not too mushy. Tuna done right, folks!

I do recommend their garlic butter, spicy mayo, and pesto sauce for the spread instead of mayo and mustard. They also carry Deep River potato chips which I enjoy much more than the Kettle or Dirty Chips brand. Not oily and they have great crunch. They even have a number of cool beverages to go with your sammy.

I'm glad they started a frequency card. This is our go to spot for lunch around the office!
author: Joe L.

description: Excellent! I wish I lived closer so that I could try all of the sandwiches! Everything on the menu looks yummy. Tried the Gouda Green turkey sandwich on a French roll and it was one of the best sandwiches I have ever had.
author: Coco Q.

description: Love this place. Great sandwiches and it seems family owned which I love. I would highly recommend this place. I love the vast sandwiches they offer on the menu. Thanks for a great meal!
author: Tony S.

description: The sandwiches are big, cheap, and delicious. I really honestly can't ask for much more from my lunch. Plus, they use OrderAhead, so I can just order and run over and grab it during my lunch break.
author: H L.

description: The customer service at this place is overwhelmingly amazing. Then there's the food which is equally as quality. I love this place! Great sandwich selection, punny names, and friendly people, what more could a girl ask for?
author: Naimah M.

description: I've been coming here less frequently now, and I think I know why.  There sandwiches have not been up to par anymore, was sloppily made this time, bread a little hard.  The last few times bread was burnt about half the sandwich.  Used to be a lot better.
author: Pose M.

description: Totally 100% fantastic. Truly. The Whatchu Talkin Bout Wilbur? Bomb. Add some Av to really put this one over the edge.
author: Ben K.

description: Love! Love ! Love ! This place. My second time ordering and the sandwich was so delicious. They forgot my sandwich and Angelo one of the owners drove to my place and dropped it off. What customer service? Who does that? More than enough reason to continue to go back again and again. The corn beef was like back home (Maryland) on the east coast. I could eat there forever. I am a happy camper along with my team at work. We will continue to order from Two Sons. They are close by within walking distance and the sandwiches do not disappoint. Thank you for your great service. Angelo you and your crew are the best!
author: Karen V.

description: Great food! very friendly staff...I was unsure of what to get at first but the staff pointed me in the right direction.
author: Eduardo F.

description: Great atmosphere people who work here are very nice and courteous. Also the ingredients are fresh and the sandwiches are delicious. I think I fell in love.
author: Robb D.

description: Walked in for lunch at 1:30 they were pumping with only one seat at the bar to eat.  Stellar customer service and great food all round. Tons of options leaves you wanting more. Can't express enough how caring this place is. The fact that they work very neat and it being clean all around makes it very inviting. Keep up the good work.
author: Raquel F.

description:
This has been the best addition to my office's neighborhood so far.  They have a HUGE variety of sandwiches to choose from, and they have very witty names (e.g. "Whatchu Talkin' Bout Wilbur, Mongolian Monster, etc.).  They also use Shiracha sauce on some sandwiches (hello, Pep In Your Step).  Nice people, they move fast, and they will scoop your bread to keep the carbs down.  Oh, and they have killer Dutch Crunch.  

The only thing that keeps me from giving them five stars is that sometimes they get a little backed up for large phone orders at lunch time, but if their business keeps booming I imagine that things will improve in that department.
author: Dave D.

description: After I reviewed the reviews I decided to come here to get a sandwich for lunch. As me being African-American, I did not recieve the "great service" and staff were not that friendly. The bread I had was slightly burnt on the outside and the guy that made my sandwich seem to rush making my sandwich, I guess to hurry up and get me out the store. Oh and did I mention that the sandwich is $7 not including ships or a drink. I know other sandwich shops in San Francisco that gladly accept African-Americans as customers and will go to the extreme to make the customers feel comfortable and happy. Staff here seems to be racist, so they can do me a favor and kiss a sloppy, cellulite, shitty ass like they are. I will NEVER return to sandwich shop.
author: Nicole B.

description: Dutch crunch bread is a must.  Ive tried most of the sandwiches and have never been dissappointed. Lots to choose from. Good variety, cool guys. Decently quick service. $8-12 for the sandwiches. Fresh ingredients. I go about 3-4 times a month. Thumbs up.
author: Gage S.

description: The bomb. Incredible Dutch crunch bread and fresh ingredients. If you need a big sandwich for a quick lunch fix, this is the best place near SOMA/Mission Bay. Parking around the area and orderahead for no wait. The Watchu Talkin bout Wilbur is awesome.
author: Devin E.

description:
I really hate to give a five-star review to one of my favorite places, because I would rather hog a fantastic place all to myself.  But, having said that I would rather see these great guys succeed and expand, so I'm giving it a 110% endorsement.

I could go on about the cowboy sandwich, the Californian, panini's, all the Ruebenesce sandwiches that turn me into an (unfortunately) Rubenesce dude (how do you spell that guy's name anyway?), but (in a rather long, drawn-out run-on) will tell you that I'm most happy when I tell the guys just the way I want my sandwich, and they're happy to oblige (and accurate).

The guys introduced me to Soppressata (sp?) which you can substitute with great pleasure for any salami-based sandwich.  I highly recommend it!  Amazingly good taste!
author: Britt C.

description:
These guys make a sandwich that will improve your whole day. Shoot , maybe even your week. 

Make sure to add extras and come back for specials. 

Five stars for lunch
author: Benjamin F.

description: 4pm, Thursday April 17th, 2014. Closed. Sign on front door and Yelp both say the place should be open for another hour.
author: Jeff C.

description: High quality, clean, friendly place.  Awesome sandwiches.  They don't have the meatball or the tri-tip every day, so I am thrilled when they do.  DO NOT go between 11:45 and 1 or you will wait in line.  Crafting every sandwich to order takes time and the line goes out the door at lunchtime.  Beware - this is not SUBWAy - you will pay almost $12 for a sandwich and a drink, but the sandwiches are so large I easily get two meals out of one.  The panninis are awesome also.  Skip the salads - not a great goodies to lettuce ratio - but this is a sandwich shop so the salads are an afterhthought.  Nice buch of guys running the place.
author: Ken P.

description: We ordered for pick up first timers everyone in the office gave them a thumbs up! Which is rare for all of us to agree. My pick was the Stuper Smoked Steakhouse which included roast beef, smoked gouda  on a toasted roll! What can I say but Excellent! the prices are great foods great this is our new sandwich spot!!
author: Fernando V.

description: This place is a good value and I really wanted to like it. That said, I found the flavors of my meatball sub to be one dimensional. Also the meatballs and sauce were center of the sun hot. By the time the innards of my sub had cooled to a tolerable temperature, the rest of the sandwich was too soggy.
author: Monica L.

description: Excellent selection of sandwiches, chips, and beverages and the service is always top notch. I'm so happy I work a block away! Try their Greuben or the Mongolian Monster. So friggin good!!
author: James M.

description: Great lunch spot.  Tip top sandwiches and good people. They do often run out of stuff so go early. Otherwise solid joint all around
author: Andrew S.

description: Bomb ass sandwiches. Lots of choices.
author: Eric S.

description: This place has never ever served me anything bad. The Buffalo Chicken Sandwich is sloppy as it is delicious. Also, I hate mustard, and they put mustard on one of my sandwiches with "everything". I wasn't even mad.
author: Patrick M.

description: Great sandwich. Really fresh ingredients, big sandwich , fresh bread and very nice people. I walked 4 miles just to try it out and it was TOTALLY worth it! Would go there again in a second
author: Salman S.

description: So sad to hear of Joe passing...great great guy..Working man...my condolences to his family and employees
author: M K.

description:
This place is awesome!  I work down the street at the Anchor brewery, and was never a big fan of the Calabria Bros sandwich shop.  But thank god for the new ownership.

Two Sons Deli has a ton of good specialty sandwiches and they have fresh bread everyday.  And my favorite part, they have almost completely Boars Head only meats.  

It is well priced for such high quality.  The service is excellent.  Amongst, if not the best deli in SF.  

Wish i had one of their sandwiches for lunch today.
author: Judd H.

description:
These guys rule - one of my favorite deli's on the west coast and a lunchtime mainstay for my work week. The location is a bit off the beaten path, but if you can make it over there, it does not disappoint.

First - the menu is big and varied (maybe even intimidating if you're indecisive), so I often defer to the guys behind the counter for suggestions or go with one of the daily specials. If you are an adventurous type and like smoky chipotle flavors, the Triple C is a next level sandwich.

The ingredients are top-notch and they have some of the best meats in the city. They also have an incredible drink selection. I know that's probably not priority #1 in a deli but I am always impressed by the variety of options in their triple-wide drink fridge.

Good service, great owner/operators, solid food, highly recommended if you're in the area.
author: Josh S.

description: I'm a big fan of this spot. I think it used to be under a different name. it was great then, and it's great now - perhaps with even more sandwich options. They have some really cool combos like the Mongolian Monster that you may not find at other sandwich spots. That one was delicious - sweet and hot, tons of roast beef. The combo of Teriyaki and Sriracha sounded risky at first, but on the sandwich it was awesome. The guys working here are really cool too. Customer service is clearly one of their top priorities, no matter how busy the place is. I wouldn't rate it quite as high as places like Molinari's or Miller's, but this place is cheaper, quicker and just about as good. I'd be a regular if I worked a little closer, but regardless I go here when I can. Worth checking out for sure.
author: Adam F.

description:
Love this place.  Good bread, Boar's Head meats, a well though out selection of cleverly named sandwiches.  What more could you want?

Seriously, My Gouda's Green, Mongolian Monster, and Dirty Bird are enough to keep me satiated.  Plus, they have a rewards program:  Buy 9 sandwiches, get the 10th free.

I'm glad I work within walking distance of this place.
author: Brian M.

description: Great food, great service! I love family owned and operated deli's, especially ones with cleverly named sandwiches that brings a special uniqueness to the whole experience.
author: Omar M.

description: The names of the sandwiches here are great. The selection of vegetarian options, not so much. There's an egg salad, falafel and a grilled cheese. I would have preferred they took a hint from Mr. Pickles and had some fried tofu to sub out on any sandwich, or better yet some tempeh. My sandwich was great though and the staff was friendly. Unfortunately they had some kind of sports argument program on the television which was really annoying, so I'm knocking them down to 3 stars for that too.
author: Waves P.

description: I've never seen so many sandwiches on a menu before! (means I won't be getting bored with it). LOVE that this place is in my neighborhood! Easy parking. I've been in a handful of times and just love it! I recommend the "dirty bird" on Dutch crunch toasted to start!
author: Jodie S.

description:
got the tuna panini.  

pretty good sandwhich.  not overly mayo, which i prefer.

came in a big group, and they were pretty fast.

decent prices, would go back.
author: Henry H.

description: Joe and George Jr. are super stars! Have been getting sandwiches from this family for more than 4 years now.  Sheer deliciousness, every time.
author: Adam K.

description: I love there sandwiches! They have creative names but tastes better than they sound. The owner/employees are friendly and very clean shop. Definitely one of the best sandwich spots in the city.
author: Alex D.

description: Joe and his sandwiches are amazing. Great quality food, delicious taste and a real friendly feel in the place. My bf and I saw the yelp reviews and decided to check it out. We were not disappointed! Will definitely be back soon!!
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Great little sandwich place, good and hearty food, great choice of drinks!
author: Keith R.

description: There are enough sandwiches here that you could have a different one every day for a month... and then start all over again the next month because you've forgotten what the first ones taste like. They're good and filling but not particularly memorable, which is a shame considering what they charge.
author: Steven L.

description:
This is by far my favorite Sandwich place in San Francisco. I eat there several times a week for breakfast and for lunch and leave more than satisfied every week. Great atmosphere, friendly staff and fresh ingredients. 

Not your typical standard sandwiches you can get everywhere, these guys actually got creative and came up with some really great ideas. You won't be disappointed.
author: Nima E.

description: I find it impossible to bypass Two Sons on an empty stomach. They have great sandwiches, panini, and deli salads for lunch. I like anything with bleu cheese. So, I love the Buffalo Firebird, the Calling Cobb, and others. They also offer bagels, danishes, and breakfast sandwiches in the morning. NOM!
author: Wil E.

description:
I went there today with some coworkers after reading the rave reviews on here, and was very, very disappointed. All of us were - we ordered 4 sandwiches (Custom veggie, Falafel, Pass the pastrami, and the Cowboy way), all of them puny, disappointing excuses for a sandwich. They left out many of the ingredients listed, the sandwiches were dry, and they were all quite small for what we paid for them. The custom veggie was carelessly constructed, some of the ingredients only on 1 half of the bread, I had to open and rearrange myself. Needless to say not what I want for my lunch experience.

Maybe we hit them on an off day, but it was disappointing enough that I wanted to write my experience to warn people who are getting their hopes up about this place. 2 stars are for the service, the woman behind the counter is very nice.

I won't be going back.
author: Chichi L.

description: Sandwiches are great. I recommend the "what you talkin bout Wilbur" or something like that. For the serious meat eater.
author: Daniel M.

description: I go to this place a lot because they make great sandwiches, but my last visit i had the Cluck for a buck that comes with bacon.  The sandwich was not as hot as it normally is and the bacon was barely noticeable in taste and probably only two strips.  Overall it was a forgettable sandwich surprisingly.  Not sure what happened there, becoming inconsistent maybe?  There is a new guy making sandwiches there, though not sure if that would make a difference.
author: Ken L.

description: I was sad when Calabria Bros. left, but the Two Sons are doing great work.  The pour-over coffee is just what I need in the mornings, and I'm a big fan of the grilled sandwiches.  Two Sons is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood.
author: J.R. E.

description: Delicious sandwiches and super friendly service!  I had a My Gouda's Green (turkey, coppa, smoked gouda--yum) and I tried the Mongolian Monster (roast beef, muenster, jalapenos, with teriyaki and sriracha sauce--spicy & super yum).  My MGG was tasty and large enough to take half home.  My friend ate his whole MM and loved every bite.  Nice choice of soft drinks and bottled teas.  The guys behind the counter were smiley and seemed to be having fun!  We will definitely be back.
author: Shelley P.

description: This is hands down the best sandwich place in the city. Joe and his bro (the two sons) are doing everything right - fresh ingredients, amazing sandwich ideas (including hilarious punny names), and a home-away-from-home atmosphere. I always leave with a huge smile on my face and a happy belly. Go there! You'll leave happy. I promise.
author: Christine M.

description: First time to try this spot ...... I got the Mongolian Monster !! Soooooo good ! I wanted to order a second one just because it was so good even tho I was stuffed !!! Hahaha !! The bread was toasted PERFECTLY !!!! The ingredients were all fresh and tasty !!! Service was excellent ! Place is immaculately clean.  The prices are more than fair for what you get. To top it all off. There's tons of FREE STREET PARKING !! Go check not out for sure !!!
author: Aaron R.

description: Friendly, quick and unbelievably tasty deli sandwiches.  While they have tons of fun and delicious combinations on the menu, the 'Wilbur' is my favorite. Two Sons is my go-to lunch spot.
author: Nate D.

description: I've tried several of their sandwiches and sides, and they were all very good. They also have a good selection of coffees. Very friendly service, but maybe don't go if you're in a rush, making good sandwiches takes some time.
author: Alicia C.

description: Growing up, my father owned a deli, so ever since then its been hard for me to find a place that I can go to and not criticize every inch of the sandwich. Finally two sons sandwiches opened up in my neighborhood and i couldn't be happier with their sandwiches. The first time i went, i had the owner Joe make me any kind of sandwich he felt like. i only limited it to: No tomatoes and pack on the peppers! within a few minutes he hands me over a sandwich and said it was called Mongolian Monster. Boy was it amazing. They will be seeing me in there more often!  oh yeah, how could I forget the best part, they offer breakfast!! No more going to Noah's bagels where i have to wait 20 mins to order a bagel! yay!
author: Annie T.

description: Fantastic service, fantastic food. Fast, tasty, with a really wide-open menu. It's cozy to stay in or quick to dine out. I built my own sandwich with roast beef and it was incredible, piled high (but not TOO high). Next time I gotta get that horseradish cheese!
author: C S.

description: Joe and his Staff do a terrific job of serving the neighborhood. He is always there with a smile at 6:30 in the morning so the people a UPS(across the street) can get their coffee(better than Starbucks). The sandwiches and the salads are great. They are very good at making sandwiches on the spur of the moment-any way you want them.  You'll be doing ONE thing right when you visit TWO Sons Deli!
author: Donald C.
